channel.title: Movies on MeVisLab Examples
channel.description: Recent content in Movies on MeVisLab Examples

item.title: Example 4: Display 2D images in Open Inventor SoRenderArea
item.description: Example 4: Display images converted to Open Inventor scene objects      This example is also available on YouTube. Introduction In the previous example you learned how to use the module SoView2DOverlay together with a View2D. MeVisLab provides a whole family of SoView2D* modules (SoView2DOverlay, SoView2DRectangle, SoView2DGrid, …). All these modules create or interact with scene objects and are based on the module SoView2D, which can convert a voxel-image into a scene object.

item.title: Example 9: Creating Dynamic 3D Animations using AnimationRecorder
item.description: Example 9: Creating Dynamic 3D Animations using AnimationRecorder      This example is also available on YouTube. Introduction In this tutorial, we are using the AnimationRecorder module to generate dynamic and visually appealing animations of our 3D scenes. We will be recording a video of the results of our previous project, particularly the detailed visualizations of the muscles, bones and blood vessels created using PathTracer. Steps to do Open the network and files of Example 6.
